ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And withhold things of common use (from others).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and deny people the articles of common necessity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and refuse to help the needy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And do not let others ask for small utilities.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And withhold the necessaries of life.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Who are uncharitable even over very small things.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And who withholds even common necessaries.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And refuse Al-Ma'un (small kindnesses e.g. salt, sugar, water, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and prevent the utensils of assistance.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [107:7] and deny aid, as [insignificant as] a needle, a hatchet, a cooking pot or a bowl.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Yet refuse small kindnesses!) i.e. they refuse acts of goodness; and it is also said this means: they refuse the poor-due; and it is also said: they refuse things that are lent and borrowed by people such as cooking pots and utensils, and similar things, which are of benefit to people'.
